comments: For n>=1, a(n) is equal to the number of surjections from {1,2,...,n+3} onto {1,2,...,n}. - Aleksandar M. Janjic and _Milan Janjic_, Feb 24 2007
references: The right-hand side of a binomial coefficient identity in H. W. Gould, Combinatorial Identities, Morgantown, 1972.
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..400
Milan Janjic, Enumerative Formulas for Some Functions on Finite Sets
prog: (PARI) a(n)=(n+3)!*n^2*(n+1)/48 \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Nov 02 2011(MAGMA) [Factorial(n+3)*n^2*(n+1)/48: n in [0..20]]; // Vincenzo Librandi, Nov 18 2011
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
